page.title: 01SOUTHERN RETTENDON
page.content: Rettendon is an extended rural village, the centre having developed around the thirteenth century church, which is situated on the brow of Curry Hill. This area includes a school built in 1878, village hall, Post- Office cum general store, council housing estate and several large houses built in the last century. There are other small communities a mile or more from the centre of the village, also scattered houses and outlying farms. Rettendon's rich boulder clay has predetermined the land use, primarily for intensive cereal production and horticulture. Rettendon is divided by the A130 Chelmsford to Southend road and E-W by the recently built B1012 South Woodham Ferrers to Wickford road. Both these roads carry high density traffic.
